members.name: SHIFT_MASK
members.comment: This flag indicates that the Shift key was down when the event occurred.

members.name: CTRL_MASK
members.comment: This flag indicates that the Control key was down when the event occurred.

members.name: META_MASK
members.comment: This flag indicates that the Meta key was down when the event occurred. For mouse events, this flag indicates that the right button was pressed or released.

members.name: ALT_MASK
members.comment: This flag indicates that the Alt key was down when the event occurred. For mouse events, this flag indicates that the middle mouse button was pressed or released.

members.name: HOME
members.comment: The Home key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: END
members.comment: The End key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: PGUP
members.comment: The Page Up key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: PGDN
members.comment: The Page Down key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: UP
members.comment: The Up Arrow key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: DOWN
members.comment: The Down Arrow key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: LEFT
members.comment: The Left Arrow key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: RIGHT
members.comment: The Right Arrow key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F1
members.comment: The F1 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F2
members.comment: The F2 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F3
members.comment: The F3 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F4
members.comment: The F4 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F5
members.comment: The F5 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F6
members.comment: The F6 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F7
members.comment: The F7 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F8
members.comment: The F8 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F9
members.comment: The F9 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F10
members.comment: The F10 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F11
members.comment: The F11 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: F12
members.comment: The F12 function key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: PRINT_SCREEN
members.comment: The Print Screen key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: SCROLL_LOCK
members.comment: The Scroll Lock key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: CAPS_LOCK
members.comment: The Caps Lock key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: NUM_LOCK
members.comment: The Num Lock key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: PAUSE
members.comment: The Pause key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: INSERT
members.comment: The Insert key, a non-ASCII action key.

members.name: ENTER
members.comment: The Enter key.

members.name: BACK_SPACE
members.comment: The BackSpace key.

members.name: TAB
members.comment: The Tab key.

members.name: ESCAPE
members.comment: The Escape key.

members.name: DELETE
members.comment: The Delete key.

members.name: WINDOW_DESTROY
members.comment: The user has asked the window manager to kill the window.

members.name: WINDOW_EXPOSE
members.comment: The user has asked the window manager to expose the window.

members.name: WINDOW_ICONIFY
members.comment: The user has asked the window manager to iconify the window.

members.name: WINDOW_DEICONIFY
members.comment: The user has asked the window manager to de-iconify the window.

members.name: WINDOW_MOVED
members.comment: The user has asked the window manager to move the window.

members.name: KEY_PRESS
members.comment: The user has pressed a normal key.

members.name: KEY_RELEASE
members.comment: The user has released a normal key.

members.name: KEY_ACTION
members.comment: The user has pressed a non-ASCII action key. The key field contains a value that indicates that the event occurred on one of the action keys, which comprise the 12 function keys, the arrow (cursor) keys, Page Up, Page Down, Home, End, Print Screen, Scroll Lock, Caps Lock, Num Lock, Pause, and Insert.

members.name: KEY_ACTION_RELEASE
members.comment: The user has released a non-ASCII action key. The key field contains a value that indicates that the event occurred on one of the action keys, which comprise the 12 function keys, the arrow (cursor) keys, Page Up, Page Down, Home, End, Print Screen, Scroll Lock, Caps Lock, Num Lock, Pause, and Insert.

members.name: MOUSE_DOWN
members.comment: The user has pressed the mouse button. The ALT_MASK flag indicates that the middle button has been pressed. The META_MASK flag indicates that the right button has been pressed.

members.name: MOUSE_UP
members.comment: The user has released the mouse button. The ALT_MASK flag indicates that the middle button has been released. The META_MASK flag indicates that the right button has been released.

members.name: MOUSE_MOVE
members.comment: The mouse has moved with no button pressed.

members.name: MOUSE_ENTER
members.comment: The mouse has entered a component.

members.name: MOUSE_EXIT
members.comment: The mouse has exited a component.

members.name: MOUSE_DRAG
members.comment: The user has moved the mouse with a button pressed. The ALT_MASK flag indicates that the middle button is being pressed. The META_MASK flag indicates that the right button is being pressed.

members.name: SCROLL_LINE_UP
members.comment: The user has activated the line up area of a scroll bar.

members.name: SCROLL_LINE_DOWN
members.comment: The user has activated the line down area of a scroll bar.

members.name: SCROLL_PAGE_UP
members.comment: The user has activated the page up area of a scroll bar.

members.name: SCROLL_PAGE_DOWN
members.comment: The user has activated the page down area of a scroll bar.

members.name: SCROLL_ABSOLUTE
members.comment: The user has moved the bubble (thumb) in a scroll bar, moving to an "absolute" position, rather than to an offset from the last position.

members.name: SCROLL_BEGIN
members.comment: The scroll begin event.

members.name: SCROLL_END
members.comment: The scroll end event.

members.name: LIST_SELECT
members.comment: An item in a list has been selected.

members.name: LIST_DESELECT
members.comment: An item in a list has been deselected.

members.name: ACTION_EVENT
members.comment: This event indicates that the user wants some action to occur.

members.name: LOAD_FILE
members.comment: A file loading event.

members.name: SAVE_FILE
members.comment: A file saving event.

members.name: GOT_FOCUS
members.comment: A component gained the focus.

members.name: LOST_FOCUS
members.comment: A component lost the focus.

members.name: target
members.comment: The target component. This indicates the component over which the event occurred or with which the event is associated. This object has been replaced by AWTEvent.getSource()

members.name: when
members.comment: The time stamp. Replaced by InputEvent.getWhen().

members.name: id
members.comment: Indicates which type of event the event is, and which other Event variables are relevant for the event. This has been replaced by AWTEvent.getID()

members.name: x
members.comment: The x coordinate of the event. Replaced by MouseEvent.getX()

members.name: y
members.comment: The y coordinate of the event. Replaced by MouseEvent.getY()

members.name: key
members.comment: The key code of the key that was pressed in a keyboard event. This has been replaced by KeyEvent.getKeyCode()

members.name: modifiers
members.comment: The state of the modifier keys. This is replaced with InputEvent.getModifiers() In java 1.1 MouseEvent and KeyEvent are subclasses of InputEvent.

members.name: clickCount
members.comment: For MOUSE_DOWN events, this field indicates the number of consecutive clicks. For other events, its value is 0. This field has been replaced by MouseEvent.getClickCount().

members.name: arg
members.comment: An arbitrary argument of the event. The value of this field depends on the type of event. arg has been replaced by event specific property.

members.name: evt
members.comment: The next event. This field is set when putting events into a linked list. This has been replaced by EventQueue.

members.name: translate
members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Translates this event so that its x and y coordinates are increased by dx and dy, respectively. This method translates an event relative to the given component. This involves, at a minimum, translating the coordinates into the local coordinate system of the given component. It may also involve translating a region in the case of an expose event.

param: dx - the distance to translate the x coordinate.
dy - the distance to translate the y coordinate.

members.name: shiftDown
members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Checks if the Shift key is down.

return: true if the key is down; false otherwise.

members.name: controlDown
members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Checks if the Control key is down.

return: true if the key is down; false otherwise.

members.name: metaDown
members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Checks if the Meta key is down.

return: true if the key is down; false otherwise.

members.name: paramString
members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Returns a string representing the state of this Event. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

return: the parameter string of this event

members.name: toString
members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Returns a representation of this event's values as a string.

return: a string that represents the event and the values of its member fields.

members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Creates an instance of Event with the specified target component, time stamp, event type, x and y coordinates, keyboard key, state of the modifier keys, and argument.

param: key - the key pressed in a keyboard event.
modifiers - the state of the modifier keys.

members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Creates an instance of Event, with the specified target component, time stamp, event type, x and y coordinates, keyboard key, state of the modifier keys, and an argument set to null.

param: key - the key pressed in a keyboard event.
modifiers - the state of the modifier keys.

members.comment: NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses. Creates an instance of Event with the specified target component, event type, and argument.

name: java.awt.Event
comment:
NOTE: The Event class is obsolete and is available only for backwards compatibility. It has been replaced by the AWTEvent class and its subclasses.

Event is a platform-independent class that encapsulates events from the platform's Graphical User Interface in the Java 1.0 event model. In Java 1.1 and later versions, the Event class is maintained only for backwards compatibility. The information in this class description is provided to assist programmers in converting Java 1.0 programs to the new event model.

In the Java 1.0 event model, an event contains an id field that indicates what type of event it is and which other Event variables are relevant for the event.

For keyboard events, key contains a value indicating which key was activated, and modifiers contains the modifiers for that event. For the KEY_PRESS and KEY_RELEASE event ids, the value of key is the unicode character code for the key. For KEY_ACTION and KEY_ACTION_RELEASE, the value of key is one of the defined action-key identifiers in the Event class (PGUP, PGDN, F1, F2, etc).
